name: move toward
content:
Sprites moves a specified number of pixels towards a location.

Rather than specify an exact direction to move in, this block lets the sprite move towards a location. This can be useful when you want a sprite to target something or chase another sprite.

examples.name: Example 3
examples.description: No matter where the target is, the pick will always get a bullseye. Press the ‘t’ key to throw the pick.

examples.name: Example 1
examples.description: The dog loves chasing the bone! Click and hold on the bone to drag it around the display, and press the spacebar to have the dog chase it.

examples.name: Example 2
examples.description: This project has the same function as the one above but uses the “chasing” behavior to allow the dog to chase the bone.

palette_params.name: sprite
palette_params.description: The sprite or sprite group to move

palette_params.name: number
palette_params.description: The number of pixels the sprite is moving

palette_params.name: location
palette_params.description: The location that the sprite is moving toward

short_description: Sprites moves a specified number of pixels towards a location.
